bug.author: denmatfoton
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h5>System information (version)</denchmark-h>
OpenCV => 3.4 Operating System / Platform => Windows 10 64 Bit Compiler => Visual Studio 2017
<denchmark-h:h5>Detailed description</denchmark-h>
Using rational model in stereoCalibrate() (for example when source image is highly distorted) may lead to unstable work of stereoRectify() (undistorted image may rotate 180 degrees and/or may have big black regions of unmapped data) <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29060047/35826632-49978f3c-0a87-11e8-98fe-1077809aa291.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29060047/35826633-49bad76c-0a87-11e8-8108-9e32e1089c33.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h5>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/files/1696609/stereoRectify_bug.zip>stereoRectify_bug.zip</denchmark-link>
